duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct epidemiologic analyses, data management, and quality assurance activities related to sexually transmitted infection (STI) surveillance.
Support the Enhanced Gonorrhea Surveillance Program by assisting with modifications to study design, data management tools, and procedures.
Perform epidemiologic research related to STI prevention strategies such as PEP, PrEP, and Expedited Partner Therapy.
Assist with other research and evaluation efforts by performing literature reviews, interpreting data analyses, and contributing to research publications.
Facilitate the use of databases for programmatic purposes through data quality assurance and preparing analytic datasets.
Assist in the review, update, and revision of operations guidance, policies, and supporting technical documentation.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of nine (9) semester hours of mathematics or statistics and a minimum of two (2) years of research, evaluation, or epidemiologic experience, or a Master’s degree in public health or a related field with a minimum of one (1) year of research, evaluation, or epidemiologic experience.
Experience working with complex data systems and statistical software (SAS).
Knowledge of the AIDS Institute populations (STI, HIV, HepC, Drug User Health, etc.), preferred.
Experience working with confidential datasets and/or protected health information (PHI), preferred.
